@Max2011, to avoid all that and avoid losing quality with the recode, you can easily take the subtitle you are interested in:
 -change its name into the exact name of the movie (without the extension).
 -Create a folder on your desktop with the name of the movie. Let's assume "machete". Create more folders if you want to burn more movies with their subtitles.
 -copy or cut (drag and drop) the movie and the subtitles (always with the name IDENTICAL to the name of the movie file. 
 Note* If the movie is called Machete (2010) R5 XviD.avi then the "engsub.srt" will be Machete (2010) R5 XviD.srt after you change it's name. With right click and RENAME in windwos and with right click>>>get info>>>name and extension and PASTE the name of the movie keeping the extention (.srt, .txt, .sub and others) on OS X.
 -After having all the folders that you want to burn, drag and drop them in the dvd burning program of your choice, select speed 8x (for older dvd players full of dust) and click BURN:)

VoilÃ¡! :)

Just finished watching this. M 8-9. (not doing a or v because I'm not too sure how to accurately do it, but in my opinion 9 and 9). 
  Firstly, and foremost. It was a good movie. Nudity, gratuitous killing, and some poor humor.. some say it's a crappy movie for that. But THAT is what they were going for. A 70's ish (i think) type movie. And it worked. *Spoilers ahead*

 Granted it would have been nicer if the killing scenes were a bit more fluent/fluid, and if they weren't so easily told to be fake. But come on, a nude shot of jessica alba, and lindsay lohan, +steven segal as the bad guy. 
  That to me, kick's ass. It was a good movie. And to be honest, seeing him as always a sidekick, or a side villain, having his own role. Danny trejo, it's past due. 
  If you like gore, violence, and a halfshot of Jessica Alba (which, most of us do, and will download just for that), why not. Plus the plot is fairly solid. 
  Definitely worth the download, and worth the watch. Could have been better, but still a good movie.
